byline.contributor: Susan Abad contributed reporting from Bogotá, and Patricia Torres from Caracas, Venezuela.

lead_paragraph: The announcement by the National Liberation Army, known as the E.L.N., raised hopes that the end of a 50-year conflict could be near.

headline.print_headline: Rebel Group in Colombia Enters Talks
headline.main: Colombia’s Second-Largest Rebel Group Joins Peace Talks With Government

snippet: The announcement by the National Liberation Army, known as the E.L.N., raised hopes that the end of a 50-year conflict could be near.
abstract: National Liberation Army of Colombia, known as ELN, announces it will begin negotiations with government, adding to momentum toward end of 50-year rebellion; ELN joins Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia in seeking to come to peace deal with government.
